Introduction.Name: Beast of Chaos
Introduction.Description: The Beastmen, sometimes known as the Beastkin, the Cloven Ones, the Horned Ones, the Beast of Chaos or even the Children of Chaos, are a race of savage mutant humanoids that bear various traits of bestial appearance, such as cloven hooves, muscular human bodies, horned bestial heads and a malign primitive intelligence. Proud of their origins, it is said that they are the descendants of ancient humans corrupted and twisted by the influence of Chaos at the dawn of Chaos's coming into the world.||From deep within the twisted forested woodlands of the Old World and beyond, the Beastmen are a violent, war-driven race that seek only to plague and destroy the civilisations of Mankind. They prey on the weak and defenseless, striking at lonely settlements without warning in a rampage of destruction before disappearing into the protective darkness of their dark wilderness, running away from the dire retribution that fails to follow.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: +1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: +1 Strenght

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: -1 Armour save

Artefact.Name: Enchanted shield
Artefact.Description: 5+ Armour save

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: 6+ Ward save

Artefact.Name: Staff of Sorcery
Artefact.Description: +1 to dispell

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: automatically dispel an enemy spell, one use only

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: +2 dice to cast a spell

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: +1 Combat Resolution

Artefact.Name: Axes of Khorgor
Artefact.Description: This pair of axes requires two hands to use. The bearer gains +1 Attack and may re-roll any missed rolls to hit in close combat.

Artefact.Name: The Black Maul
Artefact.Description: Adds +2 to the bearer's Strength, and the bearer is also subject to frenzy.

Artefact.Name: Bonecrusher Mace
Artefact.SpecialRule: Against Castles, Empire Steam Tanks and in other situations where a roll to wound is not taken, the wielder counts as having double its Strength characteristic, to a maximum of 10
Artefact.Description: The Mace always wounds on a 2+. Armour saves are taken using the wielder's normal Strength. Against Castles, Empire Steam Tanks and in other situations where a roll to wound is not taken, the wielder counts as having double its Strength characteristic, to a maximum of 10.

Artefact.Name: Great Fang
Artefact.Description: No Armour saves are made against wounds caused by the Great Fang.

Artefact.Name: Slaughterer's Blade
Artefact.SpecialRule: For each wound inflicted to enemy, roll a D6 immediately: hach roll of a 4+ heals one lost Wound to the bearer (up to their starting Wounds total)
Artefact.Description: The Slaughterer's Blade counts as a great weapon in all respects. In addition, for each wound inflicted with the Slaughterer's Blade, roll a D6 immediately. Hach roll of a 4+ heals one lost Wound to the bearer (up to their starting Wounds total). Wounds regained in this way do not count towards combat resolution.

Artefact.Name: Scimitar of Skultar
Artefact.SpecialRule: Rolls of 6 to wound allow no Armour saves
Artefact.Description: Rolls of 6 to wound with this weapon allow no Armour saves.

Artefact.Name: Pelt of The Dark Young
Artefact.Description: The Pelt confers a 6+ Scaly Skin save that can be combined with normal armour. It also gives the bearer and any unit he joins Magic Resistance (1).

Artefact.Name: Trollhide Armour
Artefact.Description: Trollhide Armour counts as a suit of heavy armour. The wearer may also Regenerate, except that lost Wounds are only regained on the roll of a 6, rather than a 4, 5 or 6.

Artefact.Name: The Fur of Sharrgu
Artefact.SpecialRule: +2 Armour save against missile fire (including magic missiles)
Artefact.Description: Adds +2 to the bearer's Armour save against missile fire (including magic missiles), up to a maximum Armour save of 1+.

Artefact.Name: Chaos armour
Artefact.Description: Chaos Armour gives a 4+ Armour save, that can be combined with other equipment as normal (other than light armour and heavy armour). A model may wear Chaos Armour and still cast spells.

Artefact.Name: Crown of Horns
Artefact.SpecialRule: +1 to any attempts to rally to a unit
Artefact.Description: The bearer benefits from a 5+ Ward save and confers +1 to any attempts to rally to a unit he has joined, in addition to other modifiers.

Artefact.Name: Rune of The True Beast
Artefact.SpecialRule: Ridden monsters, lone monsters, the steeds pulling chariots, cavalry mounts and swarms may never direct their attacks at a model bearing the Rune of the True Beast, although their riders may attack as normal
Artefact.Description: Ridden monsters, lone monsters, the steeds pulling chariots, cavalry mounts and swarms may never direct their attacks at a model bearing the Rune of the True Beast, although their riders may attack as normal.

Artefact.Name: Horn of The Great Hunt
Artefact.SpecialRule: When sounding an ambush, all ambushing units may add +1 to their Leadership test for arriving on the battlefield
Artefact.Description: May only be given to the army General. When sounding an ambush, all ambushing units may add +1 to their Leadership test for arriving on the battlefield.

Artefact.Name: Bloodhunt Horn
Artefact.SpecialRule: Once per battle, can force a fleeing enemy unit within 12" to automatically fail their Rally test
Artefact.Description: Once per battle, the bearer can force a fleeing enemy unit within 12" to automatically fail their Rally test. This must be declared before the test is made.

Artefact.Name: The Dark Heart
Artefact.SpecialRule: The character and any unit led by him adds +D3" to their charge move
Artefact.Description: The character and any unit led by him adds +D3" to their charge move. Roll after declaring charges - if the charge is failed, the models move their normal failed charge distance.

Artefact.Name: The Plague Chalice
Artefact.SpecialRule: May drink from the Chalice at the start of his Magic phase, suffers an immediate Strength 4 hit that ignores Armour and Ward saves, for the remainder of that Magic phase, any spell cast by the Shaman will be cast with Irresistible Force on a successful casting roll which includes any double, except a Miscast
Artefact.Description: Mark of Nurgle only. The Shaman may drink from the Chalice at the start of his Magic phase. He suffers an immediate Strength 4 hit that ignores Armour and Ward saves (Regeneration may be taken as normal). For the remainder of that Magic phase, any spell cast by the Shaman will be cast with Irresistible Force on a successful casting roll which includes any double, except a Miscast.

Artefact.Name: The Goretooth
Artefact.SpecialRule: Replace one of his randomly rolled spells with The Bear's Anger
Artefact.Description: The Goretooth confers hatred and the Bloodgreed special rules to the bearer. The bearer must replace one of his randomly rolled spells with The Bear's Anger, regardless of the lore he has chosen.

Artefact.Name: Staff of Darkoth
Artefact.SpecialRule: Shaman knows spell The Wild Call
Artefact.Description: Counts as a braystaff. Also, the Shaman knows following spell in addition to his other spells:||The Wild Call (9+ to cast)|Cast on a Beast Herd, Bestigor or Warhounds unit within 12" of the caster and within its normal charge range of an enemy. The unit may declare and make a normal charge move immediately, though the charged unit may only stand as a reaction.

Artefact.Name: The Beast Banner
Artefact.Description: All Beasts of Chaos models in the unit, including characters, gain +1 Attack when they charge.

Artefact.Name: The Flesh Banner
Artefact.SpecialRule: At the end of each of your Magic phases, any enemy unit in base contact suffers D6 Strength 4 hits, distributed as shooting hits
Artefact.Description: At the end of each of your Magic phases, any enemy unit in base contact with the bearer of the banner suffers D6 Strength 4 hits, distributed as shooting hits.

Artefact.Name: Vitriolic Totem
Artefact.Description: All models in the unit bearing this totem count as having Poisoned Attacks. This will have no effect on characters wielding magic weapons.

Artefact.Name: The Gore Banner
Artefact.Description: A unit with this banner may re-roll failed Panic tests.

Artefact.Name: Preyseeker
Artefact.SpecialRule: When using the Ambush special rule, may re-roll its Leadership test for arriving on the battlefield if it is failed
Artefact.Description: When using the Ambush special rule, the unit is able to re-roll its Leadership test for arriving on the battlefield if it is failed. The second roll stands.

HandWeapon.Name: Scourge
HandWeapon.SpecialRule: Khazrak makes one attack with Scourge in each Close Combat phase, in addition to his four normal hand weapon attacks, if you successfully roll to wound with Scourge, Khazrak may immediately roll to wound again, and so on until he fails to make the required score

Armour.Name: The Dark Mail
Armour.SpecialRule: If he or the unit he is with is the target of a spell that is successfully cast, Khazrak gains +1 Strength (to a maximum of 10) for the remainder of the battle

Special.SpecialRule: Any Warhounds in Khazrak's army have a Leadership characteristic of 6, rather than the usual 5
In Khazrak's army, all units with Ambush may use their ability, rather than just half

HandWeapon.Name: Impaler
HandWeapon.SpecialRule: If any hit rolls are doubles, triples or quadruples, each of those attacks will wound automatically

Armour.Name: Cloak of the Beastlord
Armour.SpecialRule: This talisman gives Gorthor a Ward save equal to the Strength of the attack that hit him (a Strength 3 hit would grant a 3+ Ward save, a Strength 5 hit would grant a 5+ Ward save)

Special.SpecialRule: Counts as having the Mark of all four Chaos gods lor the purposes of army composition

At the start of each Magic phase roll a D6 on the Lore of Death magic table. Gorthor may use the spell rolled during this Chaos Magic phase as a Bound spell, with a Power Level equal to the casting value of the spell

HandWeapon.Name: The Beast-Roar
HandWeapon.SpecialRule: If a Wizard (friend or enemy) rolls a double when rolling on the Miscast table, then the unfortunate Wizard is instantly turned into a Chaos Spawn under the control of the Beastmen player

Special.SpecialRule: An army that contains Morghur has no General
The enemy must take Fear tests to enter or move though a forest or wood - if this is failed, they stop at the edge of the forest
Morghur moves and will engage enemies in exactly the same fashion as Spawn of Chaos

In the Beastmen Shooting phase, any unit (including friends) within 8" of Morghur take a Leadership test: if failed, the unit suffers D6 Strength 4 hits with no Armour saves allowed, if one or more wounds are caused, then a Spawn of Chaos is created under the control of the Beastmen player, the Spawn has a starting number of Wounds equal to the number of Wounds that were caused
Any model, friend or foe, in base contact with Morghur at the start of any Close Combat phase suffers an immediate Strength 4 hit with no Armour save allowed
Any missile attack or spell targeted at Morghur will never effect him unless the shooting unit or spellcaster is within 12" of him
Can use Lore of Beasts, Shadow or Death, or the Lores of Slaanesh or Nurgle if given the appropriate Mark
Can use Lore of Beasts, Shadow or Death, or the Lores of Slaanesh or Nurgle if given the appropriate Mark

HandWeapon.Name: Claws, fangs, club and potentially lethal halitosis!

Special.SpecialRule: If Dracon Ogres are targeted by a lightning-based attack, they become Frenzy
If Dracon Ogres Shaggoth are targeted by a lightning-based attack, they become Frenzy

HandWeapon.Name: Big club, rock or dead animal
